item.title: Claudine add a quote by Eugene O'Neill
item.description: "Like a saint's vision of beatitude. Like the veil of things as they seem drawn back by an unseen hand. For a second you seeâ€”and seeing the secret, are the secret. For a second there is meaning! Then the hand lets the veil fall and you are alone, lost in the fog again, and you stumble on toward nowhere, for no good reason! " -- Eugene O'Neill

item.title: Claudine add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Claudine add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "To protest in the name of morality against 'excesses' or 'abuses' is an error which hints on active complicity. There are no 'abuses' or 'excesses' here, simpily an all-pervasive system." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Claudine add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "The time has come," the walrus said, "to talk of many things: Of shoes and ships - and sealing wax - of cabbages and kings" -- Lewis Carroll
